oai_dc:dc.dc:title: LATTICE BOLTZMANN SIMULATION TO CHARACTERIZE ROUGHNESS EFFECTS OF OSCILLATORY BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW OVER A ROUGH BED
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ding, Lei
Zhang, Qing-He
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: lattice Boltzmann method
oscillatory boundary layer
equivalent roughness height
friction factor
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 3-D lattice Boltzmann method was applied to characterize roughness effects of oscillatory boundary layer flow over a rough bed. The direct numerical simulation was carried out and the flow resistance of the flat and fixed bed was investigated. The position of the theoretical bed, equivalent roughness height and the behavior of friction factor at small values of relative roughness were obtained using the log-fit method.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 32 (2010): Proceedings of 32nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Shanghai, China, 2010.; sediment.3
